text: Berkhof Groep (later Berkhof Jonckheere Groep and VDL Berkhof) was a Netherlands bus and coach builder. They made low-floor articulated trolleybuses for Arnhem in the Netherlands,Murray, Alan (2000). World Trolleybus Encyclopaedia, p. 109. Yateley, Hampshire, UK: Trolleybooks. . and Solingen in Germany.Trolleybus Magazine No. 252 (Nov.-Dec. 2003), p. 132. National Trolleybus Association (UK). . == History == Berkhof Groep was founded in 1970 by Arthur Berkhof and his son Henk. They only repaired buses. In 1989, They purchased body of a bus maker Hainje.In Brief Commercial Motor 16 February 1989 In 1994, Berkhof Groep purchased Jonckheere. In 1997, the company changed its name from Berkhof Groep to Berkhof Jonckheere Groep. In 1998, it was bought by the VDL Groep, In 2010, VDL Berkhof, VDL Jonckheere and VDL Bova were merged into one company called VDL Bus & Coach. ==Former models== *Ambassador *Axial 50 * Axial 70 * Axial 100 DD * Eclipse * Excellence 500 * Excellence 1000 * Excellence 2000 HL / HLE * Excellence 3000 ==References== ==Other websites== * *VDL Berkhof official website Category:21st-century disestablishments in the Netherlands Category:VDL Groep Category:20th-century establishments in the Netherlands
